summary: Gonçalo Trindade is a Junior Research Fellow at iBET. He obtained a BSc in Biochemistry from the Faculty of Sciences of the University of Lisbon in 2018, and the MSc in Biochemistry for Health by ITQB NOVA in 2021. The dissertation, entitled "Pre-Clinical Evaluation of Targeted Therapies Using 3D Cell Models of Breast Cancer" was developed in Catarina Brito's Advanced Cell Models Lab, integrated in the Animal Cell Technology Unit of iBET. The project comprised the culture of patient-derived tissue and the generation of 3D cell models in which the 3D architecture of the tumor was recapitulated by spheroids of tumor cell lines in co-culture with stromal cells. The project included the implementation of endpoint assays for the evaluation of cancer therapeutics, including novel modalities as antibody-drug conjugates. The methodology and data obtained on the culture and drug challenge of patient-derived breast cancer tissue led to the publication of a book chapter in Methods in Molecular Biology (Springer Publisher, in press) and was included in 3 posters presented in conferences, including one in which Gonçalo was the presenting author. After concluding the MSc with a grade of 18/20 (19/20 in the thesis), he joined the Biosystems and Data Science Group at iBET, headed by Inês Isidro, PhD. He worked on a translational project aiming at discovering ovarian cancer biomarkers, using computational data analysis and machine learning for the metabolic characterization of ovarian cancer patient-derived extracellular vesicles (manuscript in preparation). He also contributed to a project on viral vector bioprocessing, exploring the effects of media supplementation in metabolism modulation and cell cycle regulation for improved AAV production. He contributed to one poster to be presented at a national conference (as presenting author). He attended several advanced courses and workshops to expand his knowledge in distinct aspects of data science and bioinformatics, including Introduction to Image Analysis, Course on Computational Systems Biology of Cancer: Multi-Omics and Machine Learning, and Analysis of Single-Cell RNA-Seq Data. Gonçalo was a volunteer in several science promotion events like open days and European Researchers Night, both for students and non-scientists, and in the organization of several scientific meetings and conferences.

message.text:
Yesterday I had the opportunity to present for the fisrt time in an International Conference my poster on “Metabolic Profiling of Extracellular Vesicles from Ascitic Fluids of Ovarian Cancer Patients” at “The Tumour Ecosystem: Cellular Interactions & Therapeutic Opportunities” by European Association for Cancer Research (EACR)!
It was great to be able to share and discuss the results with so many fellow researchers!

This work was developed at iBET - Instituto de Biologia Experimental e Tecnológica and ITQB NOVA.
Delighed for the opportunity to be part of such an amazing team! 💪

🙌 iBETXplore Day 2024 – One community, great science and an amazing organizing team!  

Last Friday, iBET - Instituto de Biologia Experimental e Tecnológica hosted iBETXplore Day 2024, an internal conference to share and discuss research projects funded by iBET’s innovation initiative.

➡️ Some numbers about the day:
· 180 participants 
· >20 guests from partner companies
· 21 oral presentations
· 12 posters
· Insightful roundtable discussion on future perspectives of the program

👏 This post is a big THANK YOU to my organizing team for their hard work and commitment which made iBETXplore Day 2024 a success. 
Thank you also to the several other volunteers who helped before and on the day.

Everything went so well that it seemed organized by a professional company.

But it wasn’t.

➡ It was organized by a team of 7 volunteers who are also full-time scientists, some of them PhD students.
➡A team I assembled and made functional in less than three months with limited time to lead.
➡A team who effectively communicated and collaborated to organize registrations, a poster session, put up a program, prepare an abstract book, recruit, brief and coordinate additional volunteers, prepare a venue, organize presentations and speakers. And be there on the day quickly responding to all the little requests that are always part of such an event.
➡A team full of drive and willingness to offer this event to the iBET community.

I feel lucky and so proud! 😀

👏Congrats also to all the presenters who levelled up the quality of the science presented. There was even space to taste Bravo de Esmolfe apple puree with cardiovascular protective properties. 🍎💓😊

On its 7th anniversary, iBETXplore is much more than funding new ideas, developing new technologies and fostering skills development in our scientists.

Last Friday we witnessed how iBETXplore nurtures our community, builds bridges, promotes dialogue, and fosters collaborations. 🤝

➡️Were you there? What do you think?

To all the students, scientists, technicians, guests and committee colleagues: thank you all for the inspiration and keep up the good work!

Ana Paula Terrasso
Inês Cardoso
Raquel Arinto Garcia
Pedro Reynolds Brandão
Gonçalo Trindade
Lúcia Santos, PhD
Leonor Teixeira da Costa 
Andreia Freitas

#ibetxplore #innovation #biopharma #foodresearch #teamwork #weareibet
